title: Concatenation of Array
description:
Concatenation of Array

You are given an integer array nums of length n. Create an array ans of length 2n where ans[i] == nums[i] and ans[i + n] == nums[i] for 0 <= i < n (0-indexed).

Specifically, ans is the concatenation of two nums arrays.

Return the array ans.

Examples:

  • Input: nums = [1,4,1,2]
    Output: [1,4,1,2,1,4,1,2]
  • Input: nums = [22,21,20,1]
    Output: [22,21,20,1,22,21,20,1]

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 1000
  • 1 <= nums[i] <= 1000
solution_text:
Concatenation of Array Solution

Algorithm:

  1. Create a new array by concatenating the input array with itself
  2. In Python, this is simply nums + nums
  3. Return the result

Time Complexity: O(n) where n is the length of the input array

Space Complexity: O(n) for the result array

Key Insights:

  • Simple array construction problem
  • First n elements are copies of original array
  • Next n elements are another copy of original array
  • Can be solved with array concatenation or manual index mapping
